newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end steady but broad market dull.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end steady but broad market dull.

text.p: Singapore's key share index closed slightly higher on Thursday on small buying programmes in blue chips, but the broad market was dull, dealers said.
"The Malaysian second board has come off sharply. Some mini funds are selling Malaysian stocks to buy selectively into Singapore," said an institutional dealer with a foreign firm.

The key Straits Times Industrials Index rose 7.29 points to 2,172.48. Dealers said there was no market-moving news and the small overnight gain in the Wall Street was not showing much lead either. The Dow was up 3.33 points at 5,877.36.
Cautious buying had capped market volume at a thin 83.65 million shares. Losers were ahead of gainers by 166 to 124.
Singapore Press foreign led the gainers, rising Singapore $0.40 to S$25.40. Among blue chip gainers were OCBC foreign, City Development, Sembawang Corp, Keppel Corp and DBS foreign.

Malaysia's speculative stock Causeway Investment was the top active with 6.92 million shares traded. It was up S$0.19 to S$1.53. SPK Sentosa, another Malaysian stock, gained S$0.34 to S$3.72 on rumours related to the lucrative Bakun project.
IPC Corp jumped in volume at late afternoon with 3.03 million shares traded and rose S$0.035 to S$0.53.
